title: Unique monster
data:
In *NetHack*, there are various **unique monsters** that are usually only generated once, which is governed by the `G_UNIQ` flag in the code.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 List of unique monsters](#List_of_unique_monsters)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [4 References](#References)

## Description

A unique monster that is generated and then killed usually will not be generated again, although it is usually possible to reanimate most unique monsters from their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or using [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on their [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue"), provided they leave a corpse (and are not [corpseless](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless")) and are not immune to [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") in the first place (e.g. as with most [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") nemeses). The [Riders](/wiki/Rider "Rider") in particular are capable of resurrecting from their own corpses.

Unique monsters cannot have [figurines](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") generated of them, and [wishing](/wiki/Wishing "Wishing") for one will result in a random figurine being given instead.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) If the corpse of a unique monster would be left in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file, it is replaced with the corpse of a [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger "Doppelganger"), and a statue of a unique monster found in bones will turn into a doppelganger in the guise of that monster if revived via stone to flesh.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Trying to wish for a statue of a unique monster and reanimating it will also produce a doppelganger disguised as that monster.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

The primary exception to the rule of not being generated again after death is the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor"), who can resurrect himself one level stronger after each death.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit dc9fe0d8](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/dc9fe0d8bc96e006c119fa183c9c9a7c4cde2f53), the [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster") on the ground and [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") (which is handled in the same function) no longer scare unique monsters.

## List of unique monsters

The following is a list of unique monsters:

- [Riders](/wiki/Riders "Riders"):

  - & [Death](/wiki/Death_\(monster\) "Death (monster)")
  - & [Famine](/wiki/Famine "Famine")
  - & [Pestilence](/wiki/Pestilence "Pestilence")

- All [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") leaders and nemeses

- V [Vlad the Impaler](/wiki/Vlad_the_Impaler "Vlad the Impaler")

- [Demon lords and princes](/wiki/Demon_lords_and_princes "Demon lords and princes"):

  - & [Juiblex](/wiki/Juiblex "Juiblex")
  - & [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu")
  - & [Orcus](/wiki/Orcus "Orcus")
  - & [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon")
  - & [Dispater](/wiki/Dispater "Dispater")
  - & [Baalzebub](/wiki/Baalzebub "Baalzebub")
  - & [Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")
  - & [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")

- @ [Croesus](/wiki/Croesus "Croesus")

- @ [High priest](/wiki/High_priest "High priest") of Moloch and the other gods
  - Specifically, only four normally occur in a particular game, though an [aligned priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") can become a high priest by [growing up](/wiki/Growing_up "Growing up").

- @ [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa")

- @ [Oracle (monster)](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)")

- @ [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")

- [Defunct monsters](/wiki/Defunct_features "Defunct features")

  - d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus "Cerberus")
  - o [Goblin King](/wiki/Goblin_King "Goblin King")
  - @ [Charon](/wiki/Charon "Charon")
  - @ [Earendil](/wiki/Earendil "Earendil") and Elwing

The [long worm tail](/wiki/Long_worm_tail "Long worm tail"), \~, is an unusual case: it is a dummy monster that exists purely to represent the worm's body on the visual interface, and is marked unique primarily in order to prevent figurines of it generating.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Variants

More unique monsters are often added in variants of *NetHack* - as a general rule, this includes quest leaders and nemeses, who are not specified in the lists below unless they are deferred or otherwise unused monsters.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds many new unique monsters:

- All new quest leaders and nemeses

- G [Ruggo the Gnome King](/wiki/Ruggo_the_Gnome_King "Ruggo the Gnome King")

- H [The Largest Giant](/wiki/The_Largest_Giant "The Largest Giant")

- L [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna")

- Q [Doctor Frankenstein](/wiki/Doctor_Frankenstein "Doctor Frankenstein")

- e [Beholder](/wiki/Beholder_\(monster\) "Beholder (monster)")

- k [Kroo the Kobold King](/wiki/Kroo_the_Kobold_King "Kroo the Kobold King")

- n [Aphrodite](/wiki/Aphrodite "Aphrodite")

- o [Grund the Orc King](/wiki/Grund_the_Orc_King "Grund the Orc King")

- q [Jumbo the Elephant](/wiki/Jumbo_the_Elephant "Jumbo the Elephant")

- q [catoblepas](/wiki/Catoblepas "Catoblepas")

- r [The Rat King (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/The_Rat_King_\(SLASH%27EM\) "The Rat King (SLASH'EM)")

- s [Girtab](/wiki/Girtab "Girtab")

- s [Shelob](/wiki/Shelob "Shelob")

- u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)")

- u [Pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus")

- ' [Frankenstein's Monster](/wiki/Frankenstein%27s_Monster "Frankenstein's Monster")

- @ [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/One-eyed_Sam_\(SLASH%27EM\) "One-eyed Sam (SLASH'EM)")

- [Defunct and unused monsters](/wiki/Defunct_features_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Defunct features (SLASH'EM)"):

  - D [Smaug](/wiki/Smaug "Smaug")
  - H [Father Dagon](/wiki/Father_Dagon "Father Dagon")
  - H [Mother Hydra](/wiki/Mother_Hydra "Mother Hydra")
  - h / & [Cthulhu](/wiki/Cthulhu "Cthulhu") (replaces the high priest of Moloch in SLethe)
  - d [Cerberus](/wiki/Cerberus "Cerberus")
  - h [Bilbo Baggins](/wiki/Bilbo_Baggins "Bilbo Baggins")
  - h [Farmer Maggot](/index.php?title=Farmer_Maggot\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Farmer Maggot (page does not exist)")
  - h [Gollum](/wiki/Gollum "Gollum")
  - h [Thorin](/wiki/Thorin "Thorin")
  - o [Goblin King](/wiki/Goblin_King "Goblin King")
  - s [Lolth](/wiki/Lolth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Lolth (SLASH'EM)")
  - @ [Charon](/wiki/Charon "Charon")
  - @ [Earendil](/wiki/Earendil "Earendil") and Elwing
  - @ [High Lycanthrope](/wiki/High_Lycanthrope "High Lycanthrope")
  - @ [Lareth](/wiki/Lareth "Lareth")
  - @ [Master Shifter](/wiki/Master_Shifter "Master Shifter")
  - @ [Sir Lorimar](/wiki/Sir_Lorimar "Sir Lorimar")
  - @ [Transmuter](/wiki/Transmuter "Transmuter")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM changes above, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds the following unique monsters:

- k [Krooella the Kobold Queen](/index.php?title=Krooella_the_Kobold_Queen\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Krooella the Kobold Queen (page does not exist)")

- l [leprechaun king](/index.php?title=Leprechaun_king\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Leprechaun king (page does not exist)")

- n [nymph queen](/index.php?title=Nymph_queen\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nymph queen (page does not exist)")

- x [Deep Thought](/index.php?title=Deep_Thought\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep Thought (page does not exist)")

- x [Eddie](/index.php?title=Eddie\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eddie (page does not exist)")

- A [Douglas Adams](/wiki/Douglas_Adams_\(monster\) "Douglas Adams (monster)")

- D [Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon Lord (page does not exist)")

- V [Prostetnik Vogon Jeltz](/index.php?title=Prostetnik_Vogon_Jeltz\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Prostetnik Vogon Jeltz (page does not exist)")

- X [Marvin](/index.php?title=Marvin_\(monster\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Marvin (monster) (page does not exist)")

- Y [Zaphod Breeblebrox](/index.php?title=Zaphod_Breeblebrox\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Zaphod Breeblebrox (page does not exist)")

- @ [Arthur Dent](/index.php?title=Arthur_Dent\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Arthur Dent (page does not exist)")

- @ [Ford Perfect](/wiki/Ford_Perfect "Ford Perfect")

- @ [High Lycanthrope](/wiki/High_Lycanthrope "High Lycanthrope") (no longer deferred)

- @ [Mr. Prosser](/index.php?title=Mr._Prosser\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mr. Prosser (page does not exist)")

- @ [principal](/index.php?title=Principal\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Principal (page does not exist)")

- @ [Sir Lorimar](/wiki/Sir_Lorimar "Sir Lorimar") (no longer deferred)

- & [UNIX Kernel](/index.php?title=UNIX_Kernel\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "UNIX Kernel (page does not exist)")

- [Deferred and defunct monsters](/wiki/Deferred_and_defunct_features_\(SlashTHEM\) "Deferred and defunct features (SlashTHEM)"):

  - B [Ho-Oh](/wiki/Ho-Oh "Ho-Oh")
  - T [Tara Gilesbie](/wiki/Tara_Gilesbie "Tara Gilesbie")
  - @ [Dr. Wusiji](/wiki/Dr._Wusiji "Dr. Wusiji")
  - @ [Master Brain](/wiki/Master_Brain "Master Brain")
  - @ [Master Sabrina](/wiki/Master_Sabrina "Master Sabrina")
  - @ [Psi Master](/wiki/Psi_Master "Psi Master")

The [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") [Diplomat](/index.php?title=Diplomat\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Diplomat (page does not exist)") is a [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral")-aligned [ornate mace](/wiki/Ornate_mace_\(SpliceHack\) "Ornate mace (SpliceHack)") that gains +10 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +25 damage versus all monsters with the `M2_PNAME` flag - this includes most unique monsters in practice, but not all of them.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/objnam.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3955](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/objnam.c#L3955)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/bones.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 152](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/bones.c#L152)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 587](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/trap.c#L587)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 608](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/trap.c#L608)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2709](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L2709)

html:
Unique monster

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, there are various unique monsters that are usually only generated once, which is governed by the G_UNIQ flag in the code.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 List of unique monsters
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 SlashTHEM
  • 4 References

Description

A unique monster that is generated and then killed usually will not be generated again, although it is usually possible to reanimate most unique monsters from their corpses or using stone to flesh on their statue, provided they leave a corpse (and are not corpseless) and are not immune to stoning in the first place (e.g. as with most quest nemeses). The Riders in particular are capable of resurrecting from their own corpses.

Unique monsters cannot have figurines generated of them, and wishing for one will result in a random figurine being given instead.[1] If the corpse of a unique monster would be left in a bones file, it is replaced with the corpse of a doppelganger, and a statue of a unique monster found in bones will turn into a doppelganger in the guise of that monster if revived via stone to flesh.[2][3] Trying to wish for a statue of a unique monster and reanimating it will also produce a doppelganger disguised as that monster.[4]

The primary exception to the rule of not being generated again after death is the Wizard of Yendor, who can resurrect himself one level stronger after each death.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit dc9fe0d8, the scroll of scare monster on the ground and Elbereth (which is handled in the same function) no longer scare unique monsters.

List of unique monsters

The following is a list of unique monsters:

  • Riders:
    • & Death
    • & Famine
    • & Pestilence
  • All quest leaders and nemeses
  • V Vlad the Impaler
  • Demon lords and princes:
    • & Juiblex
    • & Yeenoghu
    • & Orcus
    • & Geryon
    • & Dispater
    • & Baalzebub
    • & Asmodeus
    • & Demogorgon
  • @ Croesus
  • @ High priest of Moloch and the other gods
    • Specifically, only four normally occur in a particular game, though an aligned priest can become a high priest by growing up.
  • @ Medusa
  • @ Oracle (monster)
  • @ Wizard of Yendor
  • Defunct monsters
    • d Cerberus
    • o Goblin King
    • @ Charon
    • @ Earendil and Elwing

The long worm tail, ~, is an unusual case: it is a dummy monster that exists purely to represent the worm's body on the visual interface, and is marked unique primarily in order to prevent figurines of it generating.[5]

Variants

More unique monsters are often added in variants of NetHack - as a general rule, this includes quest leaders and nemeses, who are not specified in the lists below unless they are deferred or otherwise unused monsters.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds many new unique monsters:

  • All new quest leaders and nemeses
  • G Ruggo the Gnome King
  • H The Largest Giant
  • L Vecna
  • Q Doctor Frankenstein
  • e Beholder
  • k Kroo the Kobold King
  • n Aphrodite
  • o Grund the Orc King
  • q Jumbo the Elephant
  • q catoblepas
  • r The Rat King (SLASH'EM)
  • s Girtab
  • s Shelob
  • u Nightmare
  • u Pegasus
  • ' Frankenstein's Monster
  • @ One-eyed Sam
  • Defunct and unused monsters:
    • D Smaug
    • H Father Dagon
    • H Mother Hydra
    • h / & Cthulhu (replaces the high priest of Moloch in SLethe)
    • d Cerberus
    • h Bilbo Baggins
    • h Farmer Maggot
    • h Gollum
    • h Thorin
    • o Goblin King
    • s Lolth
    • @ Charon
    • @ Earendil and Elwing
    • @ High Lycanthrope
    • @ Lareth
    • @ Master Shifter
    • @ Sir Lorimar
    • @ Transmuter

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM changes above, SlashTHEM adds the following unique monsters:

  • k Krooella the Kobold Queen
  • l leprechaun king
  • n nymph queen
  • x Deep Thought
  • x Eddie
  • A Douglas Adams
  • D Dragon Lord
  • V Prostetnik Vogon Jeltz
  • X Marvin
  • Y Zaphod Breeblebrox
  • @ Arthur Dent
  • @ Ford Perfect
  • @ High Lycanthrope (no longer deferred)
  • @ Mr. Prosser
  • @ principal
  • @ Sir Lorimar (no longer deferred)
  • & UNIX Kernel
  • Deferred and defunct monsters:
    • B Ho-Oh
    • T Tara Gilesbie
    • @ Dr. Wusiji
    • @ Master Brain
    • @ Master Sabrina
    • @ Psi Master

The artifact weapon Diplomat is a neutral-aligned ornate mace that gains +10 to-hit and +25 damage versus all monsters with the M2_PNAME flag - this includes most unique monsters in practice, but not all of them.

References

  1. ↑ src/objnam.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 3955
  2. ↑ src/bones.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 152
  3. ↑ src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 587
  4. ↑ src/trap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 608
  5. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2709
